intro: Shawia axillaris, commonly known as the axillary shawia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Shawia axillaris is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
